results.adx_keywords: Private Equity;Health Insurance and Managed Care;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Doctors
results.byline: By Reed Abelson and Margot Sanger-Katz
results.title: Who Employs Your Doctor? Increasingly, a Private Equity Firm.
results.abstract: A new study finds that private equity firms own more than half of all specialists in certain U.S. markets.

media.caption: The private equity industry has turned to health care fairly recently, and it has begun purchasing doctors’ practices at a steady clip.
media.copyright: Chase Castor for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Ice Cream and Frozen Desserts;Veganism;Allergies;Shopping and Retail;Morgenstern's Bananas (Manhattan, NY, Restaurant)
results.title: It’s Never Been a Better Time for Vegan Ice Cream
results.abstract: As the bases for nondairy versions have improved, so have the offerings at plant-based dessert shops around the country.

media.caption: Plant-based ice cream shops are popping up across the country. Here’s the chocolate and vanilla soft serve with miso caramel at Vaca’s Creamery, in Chicago.
media.copyright: Anjali Pinto for The New York Times

results.title: Let Them Swim
results.abstract: Munich has done its residents a great service by purifying the Isar River.

media.copyright: Photographs by Sandra Singh for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Travel and Vacations;Home Automation and Smart Homes;Bar Codes;Computers and the Internet;Lighting;Weprin, Ben;Accor SA;Graduate Hotels;Honeywell International Inc;University of Nevada, Las Vegas
results.title: Encountering the Infuriating, Overwhelming and Unwanted Smart Tech in My Hotel Room
results.abstract: Turns out that automatic mood lighting and motorized drapes do not make me a relaxed and happy traveler. And for the last time, I don’t want to download your app.

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Translation and Interpreters;vis-design;Spanish Language;English Language;internal-open-access-from-nl;Melchor, Fernanda;Trabucco Zeran, Alia
results.title: The Art of Translation
results.abstract: See how a translator carries a book from one language to another, line by line.

results.adx_keywords: Birds;Birdwatching;your-feed-science;your-feed-animals;internal-paywall-exempt
results.title: ‘Wherever I Am, I Am Always Birding’
results.abstract: The field-guide illustrator David Sibley says that drawing birds over a lifetime has shaped his entire way of seeing.

media.caption: “There’s a real, deep, personal satisfaction and reward for taking the time to really watch a bird and study it and figure out how to draw it,” David Sibley, the famed artist and birder, said.
media.copyright: Spencer Weiner/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Writing and Writers;Nuclear Weapons;Movies;Content Type: Personal Profile;Manhattan Project;Bird, Kai;Oppenheimer, J Robert;Sherwin, Martin J;Princeton University
results.title: Behind ‘Oppenheimer,’ a Prizewinning Biography 25 Years in the Making
results.abstract: Martin Sherwin struck the deal and dove into the research. But it was only when Kai Bird joined as a collaborator that “American Prometheus” came to be.

media.caption: A 1963 portrait of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the subject of the biography “American Prometheus” and a new film based on the book.

results.adx_keywords: Sleep;Age, Chronological;Insomnia;Content Type: Service;vis-design;internal-sub-only-except-search
results.title: Sleep Better at Every Age
results.abstract: Sleep needs shift throughout the lifespan. Experts offer tips to get more rest — no matter how old you are.

results.adx_keywords: National Assessment of Educational Progress;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Mathematics;Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Education (K-12);United States
results.title: U.S. Students’ Progress Stagnated Last School Year, Study Finds
results.abstract: Despite billions in federal aid, students are not making up ground in reading and math: “We are actually seeing evidence of backsliding.”

media.caption: The hope was that, by now, students would be learning at an accelerated clip, but that did not happen over the last year, according to NWEA, a research organization.

results.adx_keywords: Child Abuse and Neglect;Mental Health and Disorders;Research;Depression (Mental);Psychology and Psychologists;Therapy and Rehabilitation;Anxiety and Stress;Memory;Children and Childhood;your-feed-healthcare;your-feed-science;City University of New York;JAMA Psychiatry (Journal);King's College London
results.title: What Haunts Child Abuse Victims? The Memory, Study Finds
results.abstract: A study of adults who were mistreated in childhood found that those who did not recall it showed fewer psychological aftereffects.

results.adx_keywords: Documentary Films and Programs;Computer and Video Games;Labor and Jobs
results.title: All Work, No Play for These Video Game Characters
results.abstract: As background extras, some nonplayer characters are programmed to do one thing forever: drudgery.

results.adx_keywords: Art;Museums;Watches and Clocks;Travel and Vacations;Lausanne (Switzerland);Le Brassus (Switzerland)
results.title: An Art-Filled Swiss Idyll in Lausanne and the Joux Valley
results.abstract: Breathtaking modern architecture, museums dedicated to watch-making, and bucolic views from a train window await visitors willing to venture beyond Switzerland’s major cities.

media.caption: The Musée Atelier Audemars Piguet in Le Brassus, in the Joux Valley of Switzerland. The town is a center of watch-making, and the luxury watchmaker Audemars Piguet is a major presence.
media.copyright: Clara Tuma for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Cancer;Diet and Nutrition;Sugar;Diabetes;Artificial Sweeteners;Obesity;Health Foods;Content Type: Service
results.title: Does Sugar Actually Feed Cancer?
results.abstract: Many patients say they avoid sweets to help fight the disease. But while a healthy diet is important, you can’t “starve a tumor.”

results.title: Tracing Mining’s Threat to U.S. Waters
results.abstract: Environmental concerns are raised anew about potential contamination from Canadian open-pit mines flowing through the waterways into Montana’s lakes, harming fish.

media.caption:
Elkview Operations, one of Teck Resources’s metallurgic coal mines in British Columbia. Scientists believe byproducts 
from Teck’s mines are harming fish, birds and waterways.

results.adx_keywords: Heat and Heat Waves;Air Conditioning;Weather;Temperature;Gallego, Ruben (1979- )
results.title: In Phoenix, Heat Becomes a Brutal Test of Endurance
results.abstract: Arizona is used to scorching summers, but the region’s 11th straight day of 110-degree temperatures is straining patience and resources.

media.caption: Tempe Beach Park, a local landmark that features boating and athletic fields.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Decisions and Verdicts;Wills and Estates;Pop and Rock Music;Franklin, Aretha
results.byline: By Ben Sisario and Ryan Patrick Hooper
results.title: Four Pages Found in a Couch Are Ruled Aretha Franklin’s True Will
results.abstract: In deciding a family dispute over her estate, a jury in Michigan ruled that a handwritten document found in a couch at Franklin’s home after her death represented her last wishes.

media.caption: After Aretha Franklin died in 2018, her family believed she had no will. But months later, in May 2019, two handwritten documents were found at her home in suburban Detroit.

results.title: Greta Gerwig’s ‘Barbie’ Dream Job
results.abstract: Mattel wanted a summer blockbuster to kick off its new wave of brand-extension movies. She wanted it to be a work of art.

results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Lawyers Seek Indefinite Postponement of Documents Trial
results.abstract: The former president’s legal team argued in a court filing that no trial date should be set until all “substantive motions” in the case were resolved, setting up an early key decision by Judge Aileen M. Cannon.
des_facet: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump at a campaign rally in Council Bluffs, Iowa, on Friday.

results.byline: By Katie Robertson and John Koblin
results.title: The New York Times to Disband Its Sports Department
results.abstract: Coverage of games, players and leagues will now come primarily from The Athletic, the sports website that the company bought last year.

media.caption: Journalists on The New York Times’s sports desk will move to other roles in the newsroom and no layoffs are planned.
media.copyright: Sasha Maslov for The New York Times

results.byline: By Christopher Flavelle and Rick Rojas
results.title: Vermont Floods Show Limits of America’s Efforts to Adapt to Climate Change
results.abstract: The lack of a comprehensive national rainfall database and current flood maps hampers the ability to prepare for storms intensified by climate change.

media.caption: Main Street in Barre, Vt., remained covered with floodwaters and mud on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Hilary Swift for The New York Times
